/public\_api/v1/xql/start\_xql\_query

Execute an XQL query.

For more information on how to run XQL queries, see [_Running XQL query APIs_](https://cortex-panw.stoplight.io/docs/cortex-xsiam-1/90ay3tlx6l9dh-running-xql-query-ap-is).

> Note
>
> To ensure you don't surpass your quota, Cortex Cloud allows you to run up to four API queries in parallel.

**Required license:** Cortex Cloud Runtime Security or Cortex Cloud Posture Management

Request headers

AuthorizationStringrequired

{api\_key}

Example: `authorization_example`

x-xdr-auth-idStringrequired

{api\_key\_id}

Example: `xXdrAuthId_example`

Body parameters

application/json

request\_dataobjectrequired

querystring

String of the XQL query.

tenantsarray\[string\]

Note: This is only used when querying tenants managed by Managed Security Services Providers (MSSP).

List of strings used for running APIs on local and Managed Security tenants. Valid values:

- For single tenant (local tenant) query, enter a single-item list with your tenant\_id. Additional valid values are, empty list (\[\]) or null (default).
- For multi-tenant investigations (Managed Security parent who investigate children and/or local), enter multi-item list with the required tenant\_id. List of IDs can contain the parent, children, or both parent and children.

timeframeobject

Integer in timestamp epoch milliseconds.
Valid values include:

- Absolute Unix timestamp representing a date period: {"from" : 1598907600000, "to" : 1599080399000} = date period: 31/08/20 09:00:00 PM UTC - 02/09/20 8:59:59 PM UTC
- Relative Unix timestamp representing the last 24 hours: {"relativeTime": 86400000} = (24 _60_ 60\*1000 = 86400000).

frominteger

Use for an absolute timeframe in Unix timestamp.

Example: `1598907600000`

tointeger

Use for an absolute timeframe in Unix timestamp.

Example: `1599080399000`

relativeTimeinteger

Use for a relative Unix timestamp.

Example: `86400000`

post
/public\_api/v1/dataset/define\_dataset

Define an XQL user dataset based on an existing BigQuery table created by the user.

**Note:** BigQuery table must be an existing table under public\_access\_user.

**Required license:** Cortex Cloud Runtime Security or Cortex Cloud Posture Management

These APIs are only applicable from within the XSIAM Notebook environment.

Request headers

AuthorizationStringrequired

{api\_key}

Example: `authorization_example`

x-xdr-auth-idStringrequired

{api\_key\_id}

Example: `xXdrAuthId_example`

```
import Foundation

  "Authorization": "SOME_STRING_VALUE",\
  "x-xdr-auth-id": "SOME_STRING_VALUE",\
  "content-type": "application/json"\
]
let parameters = ["request_data": ["table_name": "string"]] as [String : Any]

let postData = JSONSerialization.data(withJSONObject: parameters, options: [])

let request = NSMutableURLRequest(url: NSURL(string: "https://api-yourfqdn/public_api/v1/dataset/define_dataset")! as URL,
                                        cachePolicy: .useProtocolCachePolicy,
                                    timeoutInterval: 10.0)
request.httpMethod = "POST"
request.allHTTPHeaderFields = headers
request.httpBody = postData as Data

let session = URLSession.shared
let dataTask = session.dataTask(with: request as URLRequest, completionHandler: { (data, response, error) -> Void in
  if (error != nil) {
    print(error)
  } else {
    let httpResponse = response as? HTTPURLResponse
    print(httpResponse)
  }
})

dataTask.resume()
```

Bookmark![Bookmark](https://docs-cortex.paloaltonetworks.com/portal-asset/rebrand-action-bookmark)

Public APIs for cloud onboarding and instance management.

The folowing API categories are included:

- **Cloud integration instance management**: These APIs enable you to create an integration instance in _pending_ state and provide a link to download the authentication template to be executed in your CSP. You can get details on the integration instances currently in Cortex Cloud and you can enable, disable, or delete them. You can also edit the integration instance configuration.
- **Cloud account management**: The cloud account APIs allow you to manage accounts within a specific integration instance. You can have multiple cloud accounts within one integration instance. Use these APIs to get the cloud accounts in the specified integration instance and to enable or disable cloud accounts.
- **Outpost management**: Use these APIs to create or edit templates for onboarding outposts.
- **General**: These APIs are for general management.

**Required license:** Cortex Cloud Posture Management or Cortex Cloud Runtime Security.

Version: Cortex Cloud 1.2

/public\_api/v1/cloud\_onboarding/create\_instance\_template

Create a template to facilitate the seamless setup of CSP data in Cortex.
Define the scope and specify the scan mode. For full control of the setup, you can use the advanced settings. Based on the onboarding settings, Cortex generates an authentication template to establish trust to the CSP and grant permissions to Cortex. Cortex Cloud creates an instance in _pending_ state.
The API returns a link to download the template from the Cortex tenant.

**Note:** If the template execution in the CSP fails, there is currently no manual execution of the template by API. You must perform manual execution in the UI.

For scope modifications, the parameters are CSP-specific. For AWS, use `accounts`, for GCP, use `projects`, and for Azure, use `subscriptions`.

**Required license:** Cortex Cloud Posture Management

{api\_key}

{api\_key\_id}

Example: `241`

```
payload = "{\"request_data\":{\"scope\":\"ORGANIZATION\",\"scan_mode\":\"MANAGED\",\"cloud_provider\":\"AWS\",\"instance_name\":\"My AWS Instance\",\"custom_resources_tags\":[{\"key\":\"environment\",\"value\":\"production\"}],\"collection_configuration\":{\"audit_logs\":{\"enabled\":true}},\"scope_modifications\":{\"accounts\":{\"enabled\":true,\"type\":\"INCLUDE\",\"account_ids\":[\"123456789012\"]},\"regions\":{\"enabled\":true,\"type\":\"INCLUDE\",\"regions\":[\"us-east-1\",\"us-west-2\"]}},\"additional_capabilities\":{\"xsiam_analytics\":true,\"data_security_posture_management\":true,\"registry_scanning\":true,\"registry_scanning_options\":{\"type\":\"ECR\"}}}}"

headers = {
    'Authorization': "UCoWpG4rkNzgCp2dsh8m02iVpZsskwKHz7N1tErPcUV3Wmf59Gc9kytmgOv0pDWoem3PBlORyRIPiir4OcYdWUOWAM3JyTgoCxQf4nQoTlKmFRKz9Bj5vIjluw66p9WP ",
```

Body parameters

required

application/json

request\_dataobject

scopestring (Enum)

Define the scope for this integration instance. Valid values include:

- `ORGANIZATION`: Use this to indicate an AWS organization, GCP organization, or Azure tenant.
- `ACCOUNT_GROUP`: Use this to indicate an AWS account group, GCP folder, or Azure management group.
- `ACCOUNT`: Use this to indicate an AWS account, GCP project, or Azure subscription.

Allowed values:"ORGANIZATION""ACCOUNT\_GROUP""ACCOUNT"

scan\_modestring (Enum)

Define the scan mode. Valid values include:

- `MANAGED`: (Recommended) Security scanning is performed in the Cortex cloud environment.
- `OUTPOST`: Security scanning is performed on infrastructure deployed to a cloud account owned by you.

\*\*Note: \*\* Scanning with an outpost may require additional CSP permissions and may incur additional CSP costs.

Allowed values:"MANAGED""OUTPOST"

The main payload of the response, containing instance information data. It includes a link to download the template file from your tenant.
If you use automated upload (only for AWS), the link will take you directly to AWS CloudFormation to create the stack.
Otherwise, download the template and upload it in your CSP and follow the instructions to manually upload the template:

- [AWS](https://docs-cortex.paloaltonetworks.com/r/Cortex-CLOUD/Cortex-Cloud-Posture-Management-Documentation/Manually-upload-template-to-AWS)
- [GCP](https://docs-cortex.paloaltonetworks.com/r/Cortex-CLOUD/Cortex-Cloud-Posture-Management-Documentation/Manually-upload-template-to-GCP)
- [Azure ARM](https://docs-cortex.paloaltonetworks.com/r/Cortex-CLOUD/Cortex-Cloud-Posture-Management-Documentation/Manually-upload-template-to-Microsoft-Azure)
- [Azure CLI](https://docs-cortex.paloaltonetworks.com/r/Cortex-CLOUD/Cortex-Cloud-Posture-Management-Documentation/Manually-upload-template-to-Microsoft-Azure-Resource-Manager-using-the-CLI)

/public\_api/v1/cloud\_onboarding/edit\_instance

Edit the configuration settings of the specified integration instance. After editing, there is a notice in the UI that there are pending changes. The changes are applied after you execute the template in the CSP after editing.

**Required license:** Cortex Cloud Posture Management

/public\_api/v1/cloud\_onboarding/enable\_disable\_instance

Enable or disable the cloud integration instances specified by their instance IDs. To obtain the instance IDs, use `/public_api/v1/cloud_onboarding/get_instances/`.

**Required license:** Cortex Cloud Posture Management

**Required license:** Cortex Cloud Posture Management

/public\_api/v1/cloud\_onboarding/get\_azure\_approved\_tenants

In order to onboard an Azure tenant to Cortex, Cortex must first be added as an enterprise-approved application on the tenant. Get a list of all the Azure tenants that are already enterprise-approved.

**Required license:** Cortex Cloud Posture Management

Request headers

AuthorizationStringrequired

{api\_key}

Example: `UCoWpG4rkNzgCp2dsh8m02iVpZsskwKHz7N1tErPcUV3Wmf59Gc9kytmgOv0pDWoem3PBlORyRIPiir4OcYdWUOWAM3JyTgoCxQf4nQoTlKmFRKz9Bj5vIjluw66p9WP `

x-xdr-auth-idStringrequired

{api\_key\_id}

Example: `241`

/public\_api/v1/cloud\_onboarding/list\_regions

Get a list of all available regions for the specified cloud service provider.

**Required license:** Cortex Cloud Posture Management

Request headers

AuthorizationStringrequired

{api\_key}

Example: `UCoWpG4rkNzgCp2dsh8m02iVpZsskwKHz7N1tErPcUV3Wmf59Gc9kytmgOv0pDWoem3PBlORyRIPiir4OcYdWUOWAM3JyTgoCxQf4nQoTlKmFRKz9Bj5vIjluw66p9WP `

x-xdr-auth-idStringrequired

{api\_key\_id}

Example: `241`

CLIENT REQUESTBash+curlPythonRubyJavascriptJavaSwiftPHPCC#

`






`

```
import http.client

payload = "{\"request_data\":{\"cloud_provider\":\"AWS\"}}"
```

/public\_api/v1/cloud\_onboarding/create\_outpost\_template

Create a template to onboard an outpost. Define the custom resource tags you want associated with the outpost and Cortex generates an authentication template to establish trust to the CSP and grant permissions to Cortex.

**Required license:** Cortex Cloud Posture Management

Request headers

AuthorizationStringrequired

{api\_key}

Example: `UCoWpG4rkNzgCp2dsh8m02iVpZsskwKHz7N1tErPcUV3Wmf59Gc9kytmgOv0pDWoem3PBlORyRIPiir4OcYdWUOWAM3JyTgoCxQf4nQoTlKmFRKz9Bj5vIjluw66p9WP `

x-xdr-auth-idStringrequired

{api\_key\_id}

Example: `241`

CLIENT REQUESTBash+curlPythonRubyJavascriptJavaSwiftPHPCC#

__

`






`

```
import http.client

conn = http.client.HTTPConnection("undefinedundefined")

payload = "{\"request_data\":{\"cloud_provider\":\"AWS\",\"custom_resources_tags\":[{\"key\":\"purpose\",\"value\":\"outpost\"}]}}"

headers = {
    'Authorization': "UCoWpG4rkNzgCp2dsh8m02iVpZsskwKHz7N1tErPcUV3Wmf59Gc9kytmgOv0pDWoem3PBlORyRIPiir4OcYdWUOWAM3JyTgoCxQf4nQoTlKmFRKz9Bj5vIjluw66p9WP ",
    'x-xdr-auth-id': "241",
    'content-type': "application/json"
    }

conn.request("POST", "/public_api/v1/cloud_onboarding/create_outpost_template", payload, headers)

res = conn.getresponse()
data = res.read()

print(data.decode("utf-8"))
```

post
/public\_api/appsec/v1/application

Creates a new application asset based on the provided details, such as name, criticality, and asset selection.

**Required license:** Cortex Cloud Runtime Security or Cortex Cloud Posture Management

Request headers

x-cas-trace-idString

Example: `xCasTraceId_example`

AuthorizationStringrequired

{api\_key}

Example: `UCoWpG4rkNzgCp2dsh8m02iVpZsskwKHz7N1tErPcUV3Wmf59Gc9kytmgOv0pDWoem3PBlORyRIPiir4OcYdWUOWAM3JyTgoCxQf4nQoTlKmFRKz9Bj5vIjluw66p9WP `

x-xdr-auth-idStringrequired

{api\_key\_id}

Example: `241`

CLIENT REQUESTBash+curlPythonRubyJavascriptJavaSwiftPHPCC#

```
import http.client

conn = http.client.HTTPSConnection("api-yourfqdn")

payload = "{\"name\":\"string\",\"category\":\"Business Application\",\"businessCriticality\":\"Critical\",\"creationType\":\"Auto\",\"description\":\"string\",\"compliance\":[\"PCI-DSS\"],\"businessOwner\":[\"string\"],\"devOwner\":[\"string\"],\"devOpsOwner\":[\"string\"],\"productManager\":[\"string\"],\"assetSelection\":{\"selectionType\":\"filter\",\"section\":\"code\",\"filter\":{\"values\":[\"string\"],\"provider\":\"CIRCLE_CI\",\"filterType\":\"REPOSITORY\"},\"assetIds\":[\"string\"]}}"

headers = {
    'x-cas-trace-id': "SOME_STRING_VALUE",
    'Authorization': "UCoWpG4rkNzgCp2dsh8m02iVpZsskwKHz7N1tErPcUV3Wmf59Gc9kytmgOv0pDWoem3PBlORyRIPiir4OcYdWUOWAM3JyTgoCxQf4nQoTlKmFRKz9Bj5vIjluw66p9WP ",
    'x-xdr-auth-id': "241",
    'content-type': "application/json"
    }

conn.request("POST", "/public_api/appsec/v1/application", payload, headers)

res = conn.getresponse()
data = res.read()

print(data.decode("utf-8"))
```

```
import Foundation

let headers = [\
  "x-cas-trace-id": "SOME_STRING_VALUE",\
  "Authorization": "UCoWpG4rkNzgCp2dsh8m02iVpZsskwKHz7N1tErPcUV3Wmf59Gc9kytmgOv0pDWoem3PBlORyRIPiir4OcYdWUOWAM3JyTgoCxQf4nQoTlKmFRKz9Bj5vIjluw66p9WP ",\
  "x-xdr-auth-id": "241",\
  "content-type": "application/json"\
]
let parameters = [\
  "name": "string",\
  "category": "Business Application",\
  "businessCriticality": "Critical",\
  "creationType": "Auto",\
  "description": "string",\
  "compliance": ["PCI-DSS"],\
  "businessOwner": ["string"],\
  "devOwner": ["string"],\
  "devOpsOwner": ["string"],\
  "productManager": ["string"],\
  "assetSelection": [\
    "selectionType": "filter",\
    "section": "code",\
    "filter": [\
      "values": ["string"],\
      "provider": "CIRCLE_CI",\
      "filterType": "REPOSITORY"\
    ],\
    "assetIds": ["string"]\
  ]\
] as [String : Any]

let postData = JSONSerialization.data(withJSONObject: parameters, options: [])

let request = NSMutableURLRequest(url: NSURL(string: "https://api-yourfqdn/public_api/appsec/v1/application")! as URL,
                                        cachePolicy: .useProtocolCachePolicy,
                                    timeoutInterval: 10.0)
request.httpMethod = "POST"
```

Deletes a specific application asset identified by its unique ID.

**Required license:** Cortex Cloud Runtime Security or Cortex Cloud Posture Management

x-xdr-auth-idStringrequired

{api\_key\_id}

Example: `241`

/public\_api/appsec/v1/application/{applicationId}

Updates the attributes of an existing application asset identified by its unique ID.

**Required license:** Cortex Cloud Runtime Security or Cortex Cloud Posture Management

Path parameters

applicationIdStringrequired

Example: `applicationId_example`

Request headers

x-cas-trace-idString

Example: `xCasTraceId_example`

AuthorizationStringrequired

{api\_key}

Example: `UCoWpG4rkNzgCp2dsh8m02iVpZsskwKHz7N1tErPcUV3Wmf59Gc9kytmgOv0pDWoem3PBlORyRIPiir4OcYdWUOWAM3JyTgoCxQf4nQoTlKmFRKz9Bj5vIjluw66p9WP `

x-xdr-auth-idStringrequired

{api\_key\_id}

Example: `241`

/public\_api/appsec/v1/integrations

Application Security capabilities support a wide range of Cloud DevSecOps systems integrations.

Get details on the Application Security integrations in your Cortex environment. You can filter the type and category of integrations you want to list.

**Required license:** Cortex Cloud Runtime Security or Cortex Cloud Posture Management

x-xdr-auth-idStringrequired

{api\_key\_id}

An Application Security policy defines how a system should respond to application security threats. It includes conditions that trigger the policy, the scope of its application, and the actions to be taken when these conditions are met. When a policy detects a threat, it generates an issue for remediation.

Be aware of the following limitations when creating policies:

1. **CI/CD Risks Finding Type**
   - Only the **periodic scan** trigger is supported.

   - Only the **reportIssue** action is available.

   - For **conditions**, the `category` parameter supports the following values:
     - Application
     - CI/CD Instance
     - CI/CD Pipeline
     - VCS Collaborator
     - VCS Organization
   - For **scope filters**, only the following parameters are supported:
     - Business Criticality
     - Business Owner
     - Provider
     - CI/CD Instance Name
     - CI/CD Instance ID
     - CI/CD Pipeline Name
     - CI/CD Pipeline ID
     - VCS Collaborator Name
     - VCS Collaborator Email
     - VCS Collaborator MFA Enabled
     - VCS Collaborator Last Observed
     - VCS Organization Name
2. **Other Finding Types**
   - For all other finding types, the `category` parameter supports `Application` and `Repository` values.

   - For **scope filters**, only the following parameters are supported:
     - Business Criticality
     - Business Owner
     - Application Provider
     - Is Public Repository
     - Repository Name
     - Repository ID
3. **Third-Party Integration Data**
   - For ingested data from third-party integrations:
     - Only the **periodic scan** trigger is supported.
     - Only the **create an issue** action is available.
4. **Multiple Finding Types in Conditions**
   - When selecting multiple finding types, only common filters are available.
   - To use filters specific to a finding type, add a separate condition group using **OR** logic.
5. **Condition and Scope Depth**
   - The UI supports up to **2 levels** of nesting for conditions and scope.
   - The API allows up to **10 levels** for more complex policy configurations.
6. **Scope vs. Asset Groups**
   - You can define either a **scope** or specify **assetGroupIds**, but not both in the same policy.
   - If both are included, only the asset groups will be applied.
7. **Empty Results During Configuration**
   - Conditions and scope filters may return **empty results** during policy configuration.
   - Policies can still be saved for future use.
   - Once the policies are active, they will evaluate the conditions and trigger defined actions if matching results are found.

Body parameters

required

application/json

Define the Application Security policy

namestring

A unique name for the AppSec policy

descriptionstring

A brief description of the AppSec policy's purpose

triggersobject

Defines when the AppSec policy should be evaluated. At least one of the options must be `true`.

periodicboolean

If `true`, the AppSec policy is evaluated periodically (for example, daily or weekly).

prboolean

If `true`, the AppSec policy is evaluated on Pull Request (PR) events

cicdboolean

If `true`, the Appsec policy is evaluated on CI/CD pipeline events.

conditionsobjectrequired

Defines the specific criteria (conditions) that will trigger the policy. You can combine multiple conditions to create complex rules for when the policy should be applied.

**Note:**

- When used in `AND`, all conditions within this array must be met.
- When used in `OR`, at least one condition within this array must be met.
- Selecting `Finding Type` determines which condition fields you can configure. Each `Finding Type` supports a specific set of condition fields. To see which fields are allowed for each type, see the [Supported Condition Fields](https://docs-cortex.paloaltonetworks.com/r/FayJxExoL5CJfFeJEXjZCQ/uQcU0QqgPdNKwXMTgQ4S8w?section=supported-condition-fields) table.

This table defines the available fields for building policy conditions when you select `Finding Type` option.

| Field Name ( `SEARCH_FIELD`) | Pretty Name ( `FIELD_PRETTY_NAME`) | Data Type (DATA\_TYPE) | Allowed SEARCH\_TYPE Values | Possible Values (ENUM\_VALUES) | Description | Relevant Finding Types |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Severity | Severity | ENUM | EQ, NEQ | CRITICAL, HIGH, MEDIUM, LOW | The severity level of the finding. | CI/CD Risks, Vulnerabilities, IaC Misconfiguration, Licenses, Operational Risk, Secrets, Code Weaknesses |
| RiskFactors | Risk Factors | ENUM | EQ, NEQ, CONTAINS\_IN\_LIST | Critical severity, High severity, Medium severity, Has fix, Remote execution, DoS - Low, DoS - High, Recent vulnerability, Exploit exists - in the wild, Exploit exists - POC, Attack complexity: low, Attack vector: network | Categorizes the risk factors associated with the finding. | Vulnerabilities |
| CVE ID | Cve Id | STRING | EQ, NEQ, CONTAINS | Any string representing a CVE ID (e.g., CVE-2023-1234). | The Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE) identifier. | Vulnerabilities |
| CVSS | Cvss | INT | EQ, NEQ, LT, GT, LTE, GTE | Any integer representing a CVSS score (0-10). | Common Vulnerability Scoring System score. | Vulnerabilities |
| Package Name | Package Name | STRING | EQ, NEQ, CONTAINS | Any string representing a package name. | The name of the software package. | Vulnerabilities, Licenses, Operational Risk |
| Package Version | Package Version | STRING | EQ, NEQ, LT, GT | Any string representing a package version (e.g., 1.0.0, 2.1-beta). | The version of the software package. | Vulnerabilities, Licenses, Operational Risk |
| Package Maintained | Package Maintained | ENUM | EQ, NEQ | LOW (Infrequently Maintained), MEDIUM (Moderately Maintained), HIGH (Frequently Maintained) | Indicates the maintenance frequency of the package. | Vulnerabilities, Licenses |
| Package Popularity | Package Popularity | ENUM | EQ, NEQ | LOW, MEDIUM, HIGH | Indicates the popularity of the package. | Vulnerabilities, Licenses |
| Package Deprecated | Package Deprecated | BOOLEAN | EQ | true, false | Indicates if the package is deprecated. | Vulnerabilities, Licenses |
| Package Operational Risk | Package Operational Risk | ENUM | EQ, NEQ | LOW, MEDIUM, HIGH | The operational risk level associated with the package. | Vulnerabilities, Licenses |
| HasAnAutomatedFix | Has An Automated Fix | BOOLEAN | EQ | true, false | Indicates if an automated fix is available for the finding. | IaC Misconfiguration |
| AppSec Rule | AppSec Rule | ENUM | EQ, NEQ | A comprehensive list of application security rule names and their pretty names. | Specific application security rule triggered. | Secrets, IaC Misconfiguration |
| IacTag | Iac Tag | STRING | EQ, NEQ, CONTAINS | Any string representing an IaC tag. | Tag associated with Infrastructure as Code findings. | IaC Misconfiguration |
| AppSec Rule Label | AppSec Rule Label | ENUM | EQ, NEQ | (Currently empty, indicating no predefined labels) | Label associated with the AppSec rule. | Secrets, IaC Misconfiguration |
| LicenseType | License Type | ENUM | EQ, NEQ | A comprehensive list of license types. | Type of software license detected. | Licenses |
| Popularity | Popularity | ENUM | EQ, NEQ | LOW, MEDIUM, HIGH | Popularity level of the software component. | Operational Risk |
| Maintained | Maintained | ENUM | EQ, NEQ | LOW (Infrequently Maintained), MEDIUM (Moderately Maintained), HIGH (Frequently Maintained) | Maintenance status of the software component. | Operational Risk |
| Deprecated | Deprecated | BOOLEAN | EQ | true, false | Indicates if the software component is deprecated. | Operational Risk |
| CWE | Cwe | STRING | EQ, NEQ, CONTAINS | Any string representing a CWE ID (e.g., CWE-79). | Common Weakness Enumeration ID. | Code Weaknesses |

SEARCH\_FIELDstring

Defines the field the condition filter should match. To see which fields are allowed for each type, see the [Supported Condition Fields](https://docs-cortex.paloaltonetworks.com/r/FayJxExoL5CJfFeJEXjZCQ/FJNCgkRJqVe~1DLN92Df9Q?section=supported-condition-fields) table.

SEARCH\_TYPEstring (Enum)

Defines the comparison operator you want to use for this filter.

Allowed values:"EQ""NEQ""LT""GT""CONTAINS""CONTAINS\_IN\_LIST"

SEARCH\_VALUEobject

Value that the condition filter must match. The type of this field will differ depending on the `SEARCH_FIELD` that you specified.

Any of `` 012

boolean

Value that the condition filter must match. The type of this field will differ depending on the `SEARCH_FIELD` that you specified.

numberdouble

Value that the condition filter must match. The type of this field will differ depending on the `SEARCH_FIELD` that you specified.

string

Value that the condition filter must match. The type of this field will differ depending on the `SEARCH_FIELD` that you specified.

developerSuppressionAffectsboolean

Use `true` to consider developer suppressions during scans or `false` to disregard them.

scopeobjectrequired

Defines the type of assets to be evaluated by the policy (the scope). You can combine multiple conditions to create complex rules for when the policy should be applied.

**Note:**

- When used in `AND`, all conditions within this array must be met.
- When used in `OR`, at least one condition within this array must be met.
- Selecting `Finding Type` determines which scope fields you can configure. Each `Finding Type` supports a specific set of scope fields. To see which fields are allowed for each type, see the [Supported Scope Fields](https://docs-cortex.paloaltonetworks.com/r/FayJxExoL5CJfFeJEXjZCQ/FJNCgkRJqVe~1DLN92Df9Q?section=supported-scope-fields) table.

This table defines the available fields for building policy scopes that target specific assets.

| Field Name ( `SEARCH_FIELD`) | Pretty Name ( `FIELD_PRETTY_NAME`) | Data Type ( `DATA_TYPE`) | Allowed `SEARCH_TYPE` Values | Possible Values ( `ENUM_VALUES`) | Description | Relevant Finding Types |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| category | Category | ENUM | EQ, NEQ | APPLICATION, CICD\_INSTANCE, CICD\_PIPELINE, REPOSITORY, VCS\_COLLABORATOR, VCS\_ORGANIZATION | The category of the asset to include in the policy's scope. | CI/CD Risks, Vulnerabilities, IaC Misconfiguration, Licenses, Operational Risk, Secrets, Code Weaknesses |
| repository\_provider | Repository Provider | ENUM | EQ, NEQ | AWS\_CODE\_BUILD, AWS\_CODE\_COMMIT, AZURE\_REPOS, BITBUCKET, BITBUCKET\_DATACENTER, CIRCLE\_CI, CORTEX\_CLI, GITHUB, GITHUB\_ACTIONS, GITHUB\_ENTERPRISE, GITLAB, GITLAB\_SELF\_MANAGED, HCP\_TFC\_RUN\_TASKS, HCP\_TFE\_RUN\_TASKS, JENKINS | The provider of the version control system or CI/CD system. | Vulnerabilities, IaC Misconfiguration, Licenses, Operational Risk, Secrets, Code Weaknesses |
| application\_business\_criticality | Application Business Criticality | ENUM | EQ, NEQ | CRITICAL, HIGH, MEDIUM, LOW | The business criticality level assigned to the application. | CI/CD Risks, Vulnerabilities, IaC Misconfiguration, Licenses, Operational Risk, Secrets, Code Weaknesses |
| application\_business\_owner | Application Business Owner | STRING | EQ, NEQ, CONTAINS, CONTAINS\_IN\_LIST |  | The business owner of the application. | CI/CD Risks, Vulnerabilities, IaC Misconfiguration, Licenses, Operational Risk, Secrets, Code Weaknesses |
| repository\_name | Repository Name | STRING | EQ, NEQ, CONTAINS |  | The name of the repository. | Vulnerabilities, IaC Misconfiguration, Licenses, Operational Risk, Secrets, Code Weaknesses |
| repository\_id | Repository Id | STRING | EQ, NEQ, CONTAINS |  | The unique identifier of the repository. | Vulnerabilities, IaC Misconfiguration, Licenses, Operational Risk, Secrets, Code Weaknesses |
| is\_public\_repository | Is Public Repository | BOOLEAN | EQ | true, false | Indicates if the repository is publicly accessible. | Vulnerabilities, IaC Misconfiguration, Licenses, Operational Risk, Secrets, Code Weaknesses |
| cicd\_pipeline\_name | CI/CD Pipeline Name | STRING | EQ, NEQ, CONTAINS |  | The name of the CI/CD pipeline. | CI/CD Risks |
| cicd\_pipeline\_id | CI/CD Pipeline Id | STRING | EQ, NEQ, CONTAINS |  | The unique identifier of the CI/CD pipeline. | CI/CD Risks |
| cicd\_instance\_name | CI/CD Instance Name | STRING | EQ, NEQ, CONTAINS |  | The name of the CI/CD instance. | CI/CD Risks |
| cicd\_instance\_id | CI/CD Instance Id | STRING | EQ, NEQ, CONTAINS |  | The unique identifier of the CI/CD instance. | CI/CD Risks |
| collaborator\_name | Collaborator Name | STRING | EQ, NEQ, CONTAINS |  | The name of the collaborator. | CI/CD Risks |
| collaborator\_email | Collaborator Email | STRING | EQ, NEQ, CONTAINS |  | The email address of the collaborator. | CI/CD Risks |
| collaborator\_mfa\_enabled | Collaborator MFA Enabled | ENUM | EQ | true, false | Indicates if Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) is enabled for the collaborator. | CI/CD Risks |
| collaborator\_inactive\_days | Collaborator Inactive Days | INT | EQ, NEQ, LT, GT, LTE, GTE |  | The number of days the collaborator has been inactive. | CI/CD Risks |

SEARCH\_FIELDstring

Defines the field the matching criteria filter should match. To see which fields are allowed for each type, see the [Supported Scope Fields](https://docs-cortex.paloaltonetworks.com/r/FayJxExoL5CJfFeJEXjZCQ/IzSzV82y5bxf_35IVsEwfQ?section=supported-scope-fields) table.

SEARCH\_TYPEstring (Enum)

Defines the comparison operator you want to use for this filter.

Allowed values:"EQ""NEQ""CONTAINS"

SEARCH\_VALUEobject

Value that the condition filter must match. The type of this field will differ depending on the `SEARCH_FIELD` that you specified.

Any of `` 012

boolean

Value that the condition filter must match. The type of this field will differ depending on the `SEARCH_FIELD` that you specified.

numberdouble

Value that the condition filter must match. The type of this field will differ depending on the `SEARCH_FIELD` that you specified.

string

Value that the condition filter must match. The type of this field will differ depending on the `SEARCH_FIELD` that you specified.

actionsobjectrequired

Actions to take when the policy detects its target risk and the policy is triggered.

reportIssueboolean

Indicates if triggering the policy should create an issue in the dashboard.

blockPrboolean

Indicates if triggering the policy should block the pull request. Ensure that the **pr** trigger is selected.

blockCicdboolean

Indicates if triggering the policy should block the CI/CD pipeline. Ensure that the **cicd** trigger is selected.

reportPrCommentboolean

Indicates if triggering the policy should create comments on the pull request. Ensure that the **pr** trigger is selected.

reportCicdboolean

Indicates if triggering the policy should soft fail the CI/CD pipeline in the platform. Ensure that the **cicd** trigger is selected.

ingestedDataboolean

Indicates if triggering the policy should ingest data. This option is only available for policies using 3rd party integrations with **periodic** trigger.

assetGroupIdsarray\[string\]

A list of asset group IDs that the policy should apply to. If the list is empty, the policy applies globally, unless other scope conditions are defined.

No content

You will receive **Bad Request** error when the server cannot process the request due to client-side errors in the request body. The error is returned when:

- Required fields are missing
- Field values are invalid (for example, incorrect `SEARCH_TYPE` for the given `SEARCH_FIELD`)
- The JSON body is malformed

Example response:

```json
{
  "error": "Bad Request",
  "message": "Invalid value for 'name': must not be empty."
}

```

**Resolution**

Ensure that:

- All required fields are included
- Field values follow the expected format and constraints
- The JSON request body is properly structured

You will receive **Conflict** error if a policy with the specified name already exists.

Example response:

```json
{
  "error": "Conflict",
  "message": "A policy with the name 'Policy for all triggers' already exists."
}

```

**Resolution**

Provide a unique name for the new policy.

You will receive **Internal Server Error** when the server encounters an unexpected condition that prevents it from fulfilling the request.

Example response:

```json
{
  "error": "Internal Server Error",
  "message": "An unexpected error occurred. Please try again later."
}

```

**Resolution**

This is a server-side issue. No action is required from you. If the problem persists, try again later.

delete
/public\_api/appsec/v1/policies/{policyId}

A Cortex Cloud Application Security policy defines how a system should respond to application security threats.

Delete the Application Security policy specified by its policy ID.

**How to access Cortex Cloud Application Security policies in the UI:** Under **Modules**, select **Cortex Cloud Application Security** \> **AppSec Policies** (under **Policy Management**).

**Required license:** Cortex Cloud Runtime Security or Cortex Cloud Posture Management

Path parameters

policyIdStringrequired

Example: `policyId_example`

Request headers

AuthorizationStringrequired

{api\_key}

Example: `UCoWpG4rkNzgCp2dsh8m02iVpZsskwKHz7N1tErPcUV3Wmf59Gc9kytmgOv0pDWoem3PBlORyRIPiir4OcYdWUOWAM3JyTgoCxQf4nQoTlKmFRKz9Bj5vIjluw66p9WP `

x-xdr-auth-idStringrequired

{api\_key\_id}

Example: `241`

/public\_api/appsec/v1/policies

List all or filtered Application Security policies.

**How to access Application Security policies in the UI:** Under **Modules**, select **Cortex Cloud Application Security** \> **AppSec Policies** (under **Policy Management**).

**Required license:** Cortex Cloud Runtime Security or Cortex Cloud Posture Management

Request headers

AuthorizationStringrequired

{api\_key}

Example: `UCoWpG4rkNzgCp2dsh8m02iVpZsskwKHz7N1tErPcUV3Wmf59Gc9kytmgOv0pDWoem3PBlORyRIPiir4OcYdWUOWAM3JyTgoCxQf4nQoTlKmFRKz9Bj5vIjluw66p9WP `

x-xdr-auth-idStringrequired

{api\_key\_id}

Example: `241`

Query parameters

findingTypesarray\[FindingType\]

actionsarray\[Action\]

statusPolicyStatus

triggersarray\[PolicyTrigger\]

isCustomBoolean

Example: `true`

developerSuppressionAffectsBoolean

Example: `true`

/public\_api/appsec/v1/policies/{policyId}

A Cortex Cloud Application Security policy defines how a system should respond to application security threats.

Get the details of the Application Security policy specified by its policy ID.

**How to access Application Security policies in the UI:** Under **Modules**, select **Cortex Cloud Application Security** \> **AppSec Policies** (under **Policy Management**).

**Required license:** Cortex Cloud Runtime Security or Cortex Cloud Posture Management

Path parameters

policyIdStringrequired

Example: `policyId_example`

Request headers

AuthorizationStringrequired

{api\_key}

Example: `UCoWpG4rkNzgCp2dsh8m02iVpZsskwKHz7N1tErPcUV3Wmf59Gc9kytmgOv0pDWoem3PBlORyRIPiir4OcYdWUOWAM3JyTgoCxQf4nQoTlKmFRKz9Bj5vIjluw66p9WP `

x-xdr-auth-idStringrequired

{api\_key\_id}

Example: `241`

Responses

200


Ok

Body

application/json

actionsobjectrequired

Actions to take when the policy detects its target risk and the policy is triggered.

reportIssueboolean

Indicates if triggering the policy should create an issue in the dashboard.

blockPrboolean

Indicates if triggering the policy should block the pull request. Ensure that the **pr** trigger is selected.

blockCicdboolean

Indicates if triggering the policy should block the CI/CD pipeline. Ensure that the **cicd** trigger is selected.

reportPrCommentboolean

Indicates if triggering the policy should create comments on the pull request. Ensure that the **pr** trigger is selected.

reportCicdboolean

Indicates if triggering the policy should soft fail the CI/CD pipeline in the platform. Ensure that the **cicd** trigger is selected.

ingestedDataboolean

Indicates if triggering the policy should ingest data. This option is only available for policies using 3rd party integrations with **periodic** trigger.

assetGroupIdsarray\[number\]

List of asset groups policy applies to; if empty applies to all groups

conditionsobjectrequired

Defines the specific criteria that trigger the policy and defines the type of assets to be evaluated by the policy (the scope). You can combine multiple conditions to create complex rules for when the policy should be applied.

**Note:**

- When used in `AND`, all conditions within this array must be met.
- When used in `OR`, at least one condition within this array must be met.

SEARCH\_FIELDstring

Defines the field the condition filter should match.

SEARCH\_TYPEstring (Enum)

Defines the comparison operator you want to use for this filter.

Allowed values:"ARRAY\_CONTAINS""ARRAY\_NOT\_CONTAINS""CONTAINS""EQ""GT""GTE""IN""LTE""LT""NCONTAINS""NEQ""NIN""WILDCARD""WILDCARDNOT"

SEARCH\_VALUEobject

Value that the condition filter must match. The type of this field will differ depending on the `SEARCH_FIELD` that you specified.

/public\_api/appsec/v1/policies/{policyId}

A Cortex Cloud Application Security policy defines how a system should respond to application security threats.

Update the details of the Application Security policy specified by its policy ID.

**How to access Cortex Cloud Application Security policies in the UI:** Under **Modules**, select **Cortex Cloud Application Security** \> **AppSec Policies** (under **Policy Management**).

**Required license:** Cortex Cloud Runtime Security or Cortex Cloud Posture Management

Path parameters

policyIdStringrequired

Example: `policyId_example`

Request headers

AuthorizationStringrequired

{api\_key}

Example: `UCoWpG4rkNzgCp2dsh8m02iVpZsskwKHz7N1tErPcUV3Wmf59Gc9kytmgOv0pDWoem3PBlORyRIPiir4OcYdWUOWAM3JyTgoCxQf4nQoTlKmFRKz9Bj5vIjluw66p9WP `

x-xdr-auth-idStringrequired

{api\_key\_id}

Example: `241`

Body parameters

Partial\_BasePolicyRequest

required

application/json

Make all properties in T optional

namestring

descriptionstring

enabledboolean

triggersobject

Defines when the AppSec policy should be evaluated. At least one of the options must be `true`.

periodicboolean

If `true`, the AppSec policy is evaluated periodically (for example, daily or weekly).

prboolean

If `true`, the AppSec policy is evaluated on Pull Request (PR) events

cicdboolean

If `true`, the Appsec policy is evaluated on CI/CD pipeline events.

conditionsobjectrequired

Defines the specific criteria that trigger the policy and defines the type of assets to be evaluated by the policy (the scope). You can combine multiple conditions to create complex rules for when the policy should be applied.

**Note:**

- When used in `AND`, all conditions within this array must be met.
- When used in `OR`, at least one condition within this array must be met.

SEARCH\_FIELDstring

Defines the field the condition filter should match.

actionsobjectrequired

Actions to take when the policy detects its target risk and the policy is triggered.

reportIssueboolean

Indicates if triggering the policy should create an issue in the dashboard.

blockPrboolean

Indicates if triggering the policy should block the pull request. Ensure that the **pr** trigger is selected.

blockCicdboolean

Indicates if triggering the policy should block the CI/CD pipeline. Ensure that the **cicd** trigger is selected.

reportPrCommentboolean

Indicates if triggering the policy should create comments on the pull request. Ensure that the **pr** trigger is selected.

reportCicdboolean

Indicates if triggering the policy should soft fail the CI/CD pipeline in the platform. Ensure that the **cicd** trigger is selected.

ingestedDataboolean

Indicates if triggering the policy should ingest data. This option is only available for policies using 3rd party integrations with **periodic** trigger.

developerSuppressionAffectsboolean

overrideIssueSeveritystring (Enum)

Define the severity of the issue (and override the system severity). If not used, system severity is kept.

Allowed values:"Critical""High""Informational""Low""Medium""Unknown"

/public\_api/appsec/v1/repositories

Get details on all repositories integrated with Cortex Cloud Application Security, providing detailed information and insights into repository artifacts, configurations, and dependencies.

**Required license:** Cortex Cloud Runtime Security or Cortex Cloud Posture Management

Request headers

AuthorizationStringrequired

{api\_key}

Example: `UCoWpG4rkNzgCp2dsh8m02iVpZsskwKHz7N1tErPcUV3Wmf59Gc9kytmgOv0pDWoem3PBlORyRIPiir4OcYdWUOWAM3JyTgoCxQf4nQoTlKmFRKz9Bj5vIjluw66p9WP `

x-xdr-auth-idStringrequired

{api\_key\_id}

Example: `241`

Query parameters

sourcearray\[IntegrationType\]

searchString

Example: `search_example`

offsetBigDecimal

Example: `8.14`

limitBigDecimal

Example: `8.14`
